tuv.seg: President - Summoning and dissolving the Dáil
An tUachtarán - an Dáil a chomóradh agus a lánscoir
Following a general election, Dáil Éireann is summoned by the Irish President on the advice of the Taoiseach (the Prime Minister)
Tar éis olltoghcháin, déanann an tUachtarán Dáil Éireann a chomóradh ar chomhairle an Taoisigh
The President must follow the advice of the Taoiseach
Ní mór don Uachtarán glacadh le comhairle an Taoisigh
The President also has the power to dissolve or end the Dáil on the advice of the Taoiseach
Is féidir leis an Uachtarán an Dáil a lánscoir ar chomhairle an Taoisigh
If the Taoiseach has the support of the majority of Dáil Eireann, the President cannot refuse to dissolve it
Má tá tacaíocht tromlach na dTeachtaí i nDáil Éireann ag an Taoiseach, ní féidir leis an Uachtarán diúltú an Dáil a lánscoir
If the Taoiseach no longer has the support of the majority of Dáil Éireann and they advise the President to dissolve the Dáil, the President may refuse
Muna bhfuil tacaíocht tromlach na dTeachtaí i nDáil Éireann ag an Taoiseach a thuilleadh agus má iarrann sé/sí ar an Uachtarán an Dáil a lánscoir, is féidir leis an Uachtarán diúltú é sin a dhéanamh
If the President refuses to dissolve the Dáil, the members of the Dáil must then nominate an alternative Government
Má dhiúltaíonn an tUachtarán an Dáil a lánscoir ní mór ansin do theachtaí na Dála Rialtas eile a mholadh
Since the foundation of the State, this power of refusal has never been exercised
Níor tharla sé ariamh gur dhiúltaigh Uachtarán an Dáil a lánscoir
